Description: Bollinger Shipyards agreed to pay the United States $8.5 million and release contract claims to settle a False Claims Act suit alleging that Bollinger misrepresented the longitudinal strength of patrol boats it delivered to the Coast Guard that resulted in the boats buckling and failing once they were put into service.

Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Notes: Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.
